name: Hilton Curacao

reviews.title: a nice family vacation
reviews.text: We just returned from Christmas 2004 vacation at the Hilton Hotel in Curacao. We had a wonderful vacation and the Hilton was good, but not great. The first impression of the resort when you are driving up to it is disappointing. It is a large cinderblock looking building that is not attractive to look at. The impression once you walk into the open air lobby is completely different. It is a beautiful open space. open on both sides, where you can see restaurants and a bar. The grounds are beautiful, well manicured, very clean and kept that way. The pool is beautiful, as are the beaches. My family preferred the beach all the way over to the left of the property. It was usually quieter, not that many people walked the 5 extra minutes to get there.

reviews.title: A great 12 day stay
reviews.text: We always found chaisse lounges, but we would put our towels out before breakfast, as people did have trouble getting chairs later in the day.

reviews.title: You get what you pay for
reviews.text: Our first room was terrible. We had reserved a king sized bed in an oceanfront room. The room had a terrible mildew problem that was awful. They told us they had no other room available for us. Our adult children were with us and their "garden view" room,( it really faced the parking lot) had no mildew smell. we stayed in the room one night only. They moved us the next evening to a room on the 5th floor overlooking the ocean that was much better. No Smell!!

reviews.title: Great Vacation
reviews.text: The food at the hotel was good. The breakfast buffet was great. A good selection of everything was available. The lunch options were very limited. Only one outdoor restaurant served lunch, the food was ok not great. We had dinner one night at the beach bbq that was dissapointing. We also had dinner one night at the italian restaurant in the hotel, and that was very good. The bars make good frozen drinks and the happy hour is good for discounted drinks and hordeaves.

reviews.title: only minor complaints
reviews.text: The staff was very friendly and helpful, and overall we had a wonderful trip.
My husband, our 3-year-old son and I stayed at the Hilton Curacao from 2/6-2/13/05.
reviews.title: Decent hotel

reviews.text: POOLS: We think both pools were the best features of the hotel (Better than the Marriott's in our opinion). The main pool has a wavy shape to it with some shallow areas and 2 areas that have infinity edges to them. The kiddie pool is great, star-shaped, 2 different shallow areas. It has a small slide to it and 4 spraying jets. Our son loved it.
reviews.title: Watch out for the Hilton Curacao Apartments!

reviews.text: BEACHES: There are 2 of them, a small one and then a second name named Parasasa Beach. The latter is very nice. The water is a beautiful clear blue. Both beaches are a bit rocky as are most, if not all, the beaches in Curacao. So if you have sensitive feet, wear water shoes.
reviews.title: Great hotel for those with young children
A Great Location and Great Resort
reviews.text: STAFF: Absolutely wonderful. The 3 times or so we made a special request, it was handled quickly with a big smile on the employee's face.

description: Set in 23 acres of beautifully landscaped grounds and built on an historic 18th century Fort, the Hilton Curacao hotel boasts two private white sand beaches, infinity and freshwater pools and a PADI Gold Palm dive center on the property, and is one of the leading Curacao hotels. Located just ten minutes from Hato International Airport and five minutes from the center of Willemstad, the Hilton Curacao is an idyllic spa retreat. A Las Vegas-style casino and LivingWell Health & Beach Club are available on the property, and Guests enjoy immediate access to a range of watersports and Willemstad activities. The Hilton Curacao resort is charming, picturesque and perfectly placed for an active or relaxing visit to the Caribbean. Conferences and events for up to 400 can be easily accommodated in this Curacao hotel’s range of event spaces, making it the ideal destination for corporate functions, social events or intimate destination weddings.
